pages.text: Using a $(l:construction/logic_circuits#logicunit)Logic Unit$(), you can create a Computer, which offers an interface for programming. Computers offer an entirely new type of engineering in $(bold)scripting$(). With the Lua language, a proficient software engineer could control their whole base from their desk.
Software engineering is an entire field that is not covered by this book, although it is easy to find resources on it. It's also not necessary to build a factory.
If you want to bring a computer with you, you can craft a Pocket Computer. Attaching a Modem to this and a Computer on the ground could allow you to communicate wirelessly.
Robotics always follows computing, and will a Turtle you can program your own robot.

pages.title: Peripherals
pages.text: There are a variety of peripherals available to computers and turtles, such as Printers, Speakers, and Monitors.

Scripting is difficult, but it can be a great boon to your logistics.$(br2)Alternatively, you could always slack off from your engineering duties to play $(bold)adventure$() or $(bold)worm$(). You could also host a $(bold)dance$() party with a bunch of turtles.

$(italics)Oh, by the way, check out Cloud Catcher. $(br2)"Cloud Catcher is a web terminal for ComputerCraft, allowing you to interact with any in-game computer in the browser, as well as edit files remotely!"
